title: A global notification for disconnects? (and BUGS)
body:
It might be my web provider, but occasionally I go through fits of disconnects.  Sometimes, it doesn't affect my game; but other times, not only do I get a random death (BUG--with NO explanation but rather the death explanation from an earlier death) but I also miss out on all of the discussion while I was disconnected (even messages from friends.)

Obviously, I'd like a better web provider--easier said than done.  But while I get why we can't become invulnerable right when we disconnect (i.e. that can be abused), the system can, either immediately send a champ running back to base as soon as they disconnect (which, since I've seen others disconnect, I know it doesn't) or at least show them what was said during a dc and properly notify them as to how they died.  When I dc and get killed, I don't have any information on why I died--because for some reason the notification isn't updated for my DC'd death.

Also, if the enemy can know that I dc that would be great.  Obviously, when a champ pauses in the middle of battle, it's probably a dc; but at least with a global notification, it's not confused.

replies.body:
The game requires a constant connection to communicate the match between your network and our servers.  It sounds like you're experiencing a connection issue that is unable to provide real-time information such as the post-death screen or will simply disconnect you.  

Check out our[ troubleshooting connection](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide which will provide you with steps to strengthen your connection and get you back in game.  I recommend performing any tests in custom games to prevent getting marked for leaver.

The system programs the player to run back to base or recall upon complete disconnection. Complete disconnections happens after the server awaits a response from the player's network for a few seconds. If the server receives no response at all, the server disconnects the player (i.e complete disconnection).

There will always be a period when the player is disconnected but is still marked as connected by the server as it tries to reestablish the connection before kicking the player off. 

If the server kicked the player off too quickly after not receiving a response, it will result in more disconnections and more game disruptions.

So why not shorten the time frame?  A few seconds of inactivity in league in a team fight or during a retreat is certain death.

Sometimes I dc in the middle of nowhere then reconnect dead--without an explanation because somehow the death recap doesn't update after I dc.

If the time frame is shortened, it'll lead to my last statement. 

> If the server kicked the player off too quickly after not receiving a response, it will result in more disconnections and more game disruptions.
